actors: Chris Evans, Hayley Atwell, Sebastian Stan, Tommy Lee Jones
plot: Steve Rogers, a rejected military soldier transforms into Captain America after taking a dose of a "Super-Soldier serum". But being Captain America comes at a price as he attempts to take down a war monger and a terrorist organization.
title: Captain America: The First Avenger
tomato_consensus: With plenty of pulpy action, a pleasantly retro vibe, and a handful of fine performances, Captain America is solidly old-fashioned blockbuster entertainment.
writer: Christopher Markus (screenplay), Stephen McFeely (screenplay), Joe Simon (comic books), Jack Kirby (comic books)

actors: Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, Tom Hiddleston, Anthony Hopkins
plot: The powerful but arrogant god Thor is cast out of Asgard to live amongst humans in Midgard (Earth), where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.
title: Thor
tomato_consensus: A dazzling blockbuster that tempers its sweeping scope with wit, humor, and human drama, Thor is mighty Marvel entertainment.
writer: Ashley Miller (screenplay), Zack Stentz (screenplay), Don Payne (screenplay), J. Michael Straczynski (story), Mark Protosevich (story), Stan Lee (comic book), Larry Lieber (comic book), Jack Kirby (comic book)

actors: James McAvoy, Laurence Belcher, Michael Fassbender, Bill Milner
plot: In 1962, the United States government enlists the help of Mutants with superhuman abilities to stop a malicious dictator who is determined to start World War III.
title: X-Men: First Class
tomato_consensus: With a strong script, stylish direction, and powerful performances from its well-rounded cast, X-Men: First Class is a welcome return to form for the franchise.
writer: Ashley Miller (screenplay), Zack Stentz (screenplay), Jane Goldman (screenplay), Matthew Vaughn (screenplay), Sheldon Turner (story), Bryan Singer (story)

actors: Ralph Fiennes, Michael Gambon, Alan Rickman, Daniel Radcliffe
awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 46 wins & 87 nominations.
plot: Harry, Ron and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.
title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
tomato_consensus: Thrilling, powerfully acted, and visually dazzling, Deathly Hallows Part II brings the Harry Potter franchise to a satisfying -- and suitably magical -- conclusion.
writer: Steve Kloves (screenplay), J.K. Rowling (novel)

actors: Johnny Depp, Penélope Cruz, Geoffrey Rush, Ian McShane
plot: Jack Sparrow and Barbossa embark on a quest to find the elusive fountain of youth, only to discover that Blackbeard and his daughter are after it too.
title: Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides
tomato_consensus: It's shorter and leaner than the previous sequel, but this Pirates runs aground on a disjointed plot and a non-stop barrage of noisy action sequences.
writer: Ted Elliott (screenplay), Terry Rossio (screenplay), Ted Elliott (screen story), Terry Rossio (screen story), Ted Elliott (characters), Terry Rossio (characters), Stuart Beattie (characters), Jay Wolpert (characters), Tim Powers (novel)

actors: Tom Cruise, Paula Patton, Simon Pegg, Jeremy Renner
country: USA, United Arab Emirates, Czech Republic
plot: The IMF is shut down when it's implicated in the bombing of the Kremlin, causing Ethan Hunt and his new team to go rogue to clear their organization's name.
title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
tomato_consensus: Stylish, fast-paced, and loaded with gripping set pieces, the fourth Mission: Impossible is big-budget popcorn entertainment that really works.
writer: Bruce Geller (television series "Mission: Impossible"), Josh Appelbaum, André Nemec

actors: François Cluzet, Omar Sy, Anne Le Ny, Audrey Fleurot
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 32 wins & 39 nominations.
plot: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.
title: The Intouchables
tomato_consensus: It handles its potentially prickly subject matter with kid gloves, but Intouchables gets by thanks to its strong cast and some remarkably sensitive direction.
writer: Olivier Nakache, Eric Toledano

actors: Robert Downey Jr., Jude Law, Noomi Rapace, Rachel McAdams
plot: Sherlock Holmes and his sidekick Dr. Watson join forces to outwit and bring down their fiercest adversary, Professor Moriarty.
title: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows
tomato_consensus: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows is a good yarn thanks to its well-matched leading men but overall stumbles duplicating the well-oiled thrills of the original.
writer: Michele Mulroney, Kieran Mulroney, Arthur Conan Doyle (characters: Sherlock Holmes,  Dr. Watson)

actors: Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Justin Bartha
plot: Two years after the bachelor party in Las Vegas, Phil, Stu, Alan, and Doug jet to Thailand for Stu's wedding. Stu's plan for a subdued pre-wedding brunch, however, goes seriously awry.
title: The Hangover Part II
tomato_consensus: A crueler, darker, raunchier carbon copy of the first installment, The Hangover Part II lacks the element of surprise -- and most of the joy -- that helped make the original a hit.
writer: Craig Mazin, Scot Armstrong, Todd Phillips, Jon Lucas (characters), Scott Moore (characters)

actors: Andy Serkis, Karin Konoval, Terry Notary, Richard Ridings
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 20 wins & 41 nominations.
plot: A substance, designed to help the brain repair itself, gives rise to a super-intelligent chimp who leads an ape uprising.
title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
tomato_consensus: Led by Rupert Wyatt's stylish direction, some impressive special effects, and a mesmerizing performance by Andy Serkis, Rise of the Planet of the Apes breathes unlikely new life into a long-running franchise.
writer: Rick Jaffa, Amanda Silver, Pierre Boulle (novel)

actors: Shia LaBeouf, Rosie Huntington-Whiteley, Josh Duhamel, John Turturro
awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 10 wins & 40 nominations.
plot: The Autobots learn of a Cybertronian spacecraft hidden on the moon, and race against the Decepticons to reach it and to learn its secrets.
title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
tomato_consensus: Its special effects -- and 3D shots -- are undeniably impressive, but they aren't enough to fill up its loud, bloated running time, or mask its thin, indifferent script.
writer: Ehren Kruger

actors: Bradley Cooper, Robert De Niro, Abbie Cornish, Andrew Howard
plot: With the help of a mysterious pill that enables the user to access 100 percent of his brain abilities, a struggling writer becomes a financial wizard, but it also puts him in a new world with lots of dangers.
title: Limitless
tomato_consensus: Although its script is uneven, Neil Burger directs Limitless with plenty of visual panache, and Bradley Cooper makes for a charismatic star.
writer: Leslie Dixon (screenplay), Alan Glynn (novel)

actors: Ryan Gosling, Carey Mulligan, Bryan Cranston, Albert Brooks
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 73 wins & 162 nominations.
plot: A mysterious Hollywood stuntman and mechanic moonlights as a getaway driver and finds himself trouble when he helps out his neighbor.
title: Drive
tomato_consensus: With its hyper-stylized blend of violence, music, and striking imagery, Drive represents a fully realized vision of arthouse action.
writer: Hossein Amini (screenplay), James Sallis (book)

actors: Justin Timberlake, Olivia Wilde, Shyloh Oostwald, Johnny Galecki
plot: In a future where people stop aging at 25, but are engineered to live only one more year, having the means to buy your way out of the situation is a shot at immortal youth. Here, Will Salas finds himself accused of murder and on the run with a hostage - a connection that becomes an important part of the way against the system.
title: In Time
tomato_consensus: In Time's intriguing premise and appealing cast are easily overpowered by the blunt, heavy-handed storytelling.
writer: Andrew Niccol

actors: Hugh Jackman, Dakota Goyo, Evangeline Lilly, Anthony Mackie
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 2 wins & 5 nominations.
plot: In the near future, robot boxing is a top sport. A struggling promoter feels he's found a champion in a discarded robot.
title: Real Steel
tomato_consensus: Silly premise notwithstanding, this is a well-made Hollywood movie: Thrilling and exciting action with just enough characterization.
writer: John Gatins (screenplay), Dan Gilroy (story), Jeremy Leven (story), Richard Matheson (short story "Steel")

actors: Daniel Craig, Rooney Mara, Christopher Plummer, Stellan Skarsgård
plot: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist is aided in his search for a woman who has been missing for forty years by Lisbeth Salander, a young computer hacker.
title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
tomato_consensus: Brutal yet captivating, The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo is the result of David Fincher working at his lurid best with total role commitment from star Rooney Mara.
writer: Steven Zaillian (screenplay), Stieg Larsson (novel)

actors: Ryan Reynolds, Blake Lively, Peter Sarsgaard, Mark Strong
plot: Reckless test pilot Hal Jordan is granted an alien ring that bestows him with otherworldly powers that inducts him into an intergalactic police force, the Green Lantern Corps.
title: Green Lantern
tomato_consensus: Noisy, overproduced, and thinly written, Green Lantern squanders an impressive budget and decades of comics mythology.
writer: Greg Berlanti (screenplay), Michael Green (screenplay), Marc Guggenheim (screenplay), Michael Goldenberg (screenplay), Greg Berlanti (screen story), Michael Green (screen story), Marc Guggenheim (screen story)

actors: Taylor Lautner, Gil Birmingham, Billy Burke, Sarah Clarke
plot: The Quileutes close in on expecting parents Edward and Bella, whose unborn child poses a threat to the Wolf Pack and the towns people of Forks.
title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
tomato_consensus: Slow, joyless, and loaded with unintentionally humorous moments, Breaking Dawn Part 1 may satisfy the Twilight faithful, but it's strictly for fans of the franchise.
writer: Melissa Rosenberg (screenplay), Stephenie Meyer (novel)

actors: Karen Disher, Jason Fricchione, Sofia Scarpa Saldanha, Leslie Mann
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 3 wins & 28 nominations.
plot: When Blu, a domesticated macaw from small-town Minnesota, meets the fiercely independent Jewel, he takes off on an adventure to Rio de Janeiro with the bird of his dreams.
title: Rio
tomato_consensus: This straightforward movie reaches great heights thanks to its colorful visual palette, catchy music, and funny vocal performances.
writer: Carlos Saldanha (story), Earl Richey Jones (story), Todd R. Jones (story), Don Rhymer (screenplay), Joshua Sternin (screenplay), Jennifer Ventimilia (screenplay), Sam Harper (screenplay)

actors: Jake Gyllenhaal, Michelle Monaghan, Vera Farmiga, Jeffrey Wright
plot: A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train. A mission he has only 8 minutes to complete.
title: Source Code
tomato_consensus: Finding the human story amidst the action, director Duncan Jones and charming Jake Gyllenhaal craft a smart, satisfying sci-fi thriller.
writer: Ben Ripley

actors: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Jordana Brewster, Tyrese Gibson
plot: Dominic Toretto and his crew of street racers plan a massive heist to buy their freedom while in the sights of a powerful Brazilian drug lord and a dangerous federal agent.
title: Fast Five
tomato_consensus: Sleek, loud, and over the top, Fast Five proudly embraces its brainless action thrills and injects new life into the franchise.
writer: Chris Morgan, Gary Scott Thompson (characters)

actors: Steve Carell, Ryan Gosling, Julianne Moore, Emma Stone
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 3 wins & 20 nominations.
plot: A middle-aged husband's life changes dramatically when his wife asks him for a divorce. He seeks to rediscover his manhood with the help of a newfound friend, Jacob, learning to pick up girls at bars.
title: Crazy, Stupid, Love.
tomato_consensus: It never lives up to the first part of its title, but Crazy, Stupid, Love's unabashed sweetness -- and its terrifically talented cast -- more than make up for its flaws.
writer: Dan Fogelman

actors: Jamie Bell, Andy Serkis, Daniel Craig, Nick Frost
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 22 wins & 59 nominations.
plot: Intrepid reporter Tintin and Captain Haddock set off on a treasure hunt for a sunken ship commanded by Haddock's ancestor.
title: The Adventures of Tintin
tomato_consensus: Drawing deep from the classic Raiders of the Lost Ark playbook, Steven Spielberg has crafted another spirited, thrilling adventure in the form of Tintin.
writer: Steven Moffat (screenplay), Edgar Wright (screenplay), Joe Cornish (screenplay), Hergé (comic book series "The Adventures of Tintin")

actors: Joel Courtney, Jessica Tuck, Joel McKinnon Miller, Ryan Lee
plot: During the summer of 1979, a group of friends witness a train crash and investigate subsequent unexplained events in their small town.
title: Super 8
tomato_consensus: It may evoke memories of classic summer blockbusters a little too eagerly for some, but Super 8 has thrills, visual dazzle, and emotional depth to spare.
writer: J.J. Abrams

actors: Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher, Abigail Breslin, Ned Beatty
plot: Rango is an ordinary chameleon who accidentally winds up in the town of Dirt, a lawless outpost in the Wild West in desperate need of a new sheriff.
title: Rango
tomato_consensus: Rango is a smart, giddily creative burst of beautifully animated entertainment, and Johnny Depp gives a colorful vocal performance as a household pet in an unfamiliar world.
writer: John Logan, John Logan (story), Gore Verbinski (story), James Ward Byrkit (story)

actors: Jason Bateman, Steve Wiebe, Kevin Spacey, Charlie Day
plot: Three friends conspire to murder their awful bosses when they realize they are standing in the way of their happiness.
title: Horrible Bosses
tomato_consensus: It's nasty, uneven, and far from original, but thanks to a smartly assembled cast that makes the most of a solid premise, Horrible Bosses works.
writer: Michael Markowitz (screenplay), John Francis Daley (screenplay), Jonathan Goldstein (screenplay), Michael Markowitz (story)

actors: Daniel Craig, Abigail Spencer, Buck Taylor, Matthew Taylor
plot: A spaceship arrives in Arizona, 1873, to take over the Earth, starting with the Wild West region. A posse of cowboys and natives are all that stand in their way.
title: Cowboys & Aliens
tomato_consensus: Daniel Craig and Harrison Ford are as dependably appealing as ever, but they're let down by director Jon Favreau's inability to smooth Cowboys & Aliens' jarring tonal shifts.
writer: Roberto Orci (screenplay), Alex Kurtzman (screenplay), Damon Lindelof (screenplay), Mark Fergus (screenplay), Hawk Ostby (screenplay), Mark Fergus (screen story), Hawk Ostby (screen story), Steve Oedekerk (screen story), Scott Mitchell Rosenberg (Platinum Studios comic book)

actors: Justin Timberlake, Mila Kunis, Patricia Clarkson, Jenna Elfman
plot: While trying to avoid the clichés of Hollywood romantic comedies, Dylan Harper and Jamie Rellis soon discover however that adding the act of sex to their friendship does lead to complications.
title: Friends with Benefits
tomato_consensus: Friends with Benefits adds nothing new to its well-worn rom-com formula, but the chemistry between Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis is almost enough to carry the movie by itself.
writer: Keith Merryman (screenplay), David A. Newman (screenplay), Will Gluck (screenplay), Harley Peyton (story), Keith Merryman (story), David A. Newman (story)

actors: Larry the Cable Guy, Owen Wilson, Michael Caine, Emily Mortimer
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 1 win & 16 nominations.
plot: Star race car Lightning McQueen and his pal Mater head overseas to compete in the World Grand Prix race. But the road to the championship becomes rocky as Mater gets caught up in an intriguing adventure of his own: international espionage.
title: Cars 2
tomato_consensus: Cars 2 is as visually appealing as any other Pixar production, but all that dazzle can't disguise the rusty storytelling under the hood.
writer: John Lasseter (original story by), Brad Lewis (original story by), Dan Fogelman (original story by), Ben Queen (screenplay)

actors: Ben Kingsley, Sacha Baron Cohen, Asa Butterfield, Chloë Grace Moretz
plot: Set in 1930s Paris, an orphan who lives in the walls of a train station is wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton.
title: Hugo
tomato_consensus: Hugo is an extravagant, elegant fantasy with an innocence lacking in many modern kids' movies, and one that emanates an unabashed love for the magic of cinema.
writer: John Logan (screenplay), Brian Selznick (book)

actors: Jack Black, Angelina Jolie Pitt, Dustin Hoffman, Gary Oldman
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 5 wins & 44 nominations.
plot: Po and his friends fight to stop a peacock villain from conquering China with a deadly new weapon, but first the Dragon Warrior must come to terms with his past.
title: Kung Fu Panda 2
tomato_consensus: The storyline arc may seem a tad familiar to fans of the original, but Kung Fu Panda 2 offers enough action, comedy, and visual sparkle to compensate.
writer: Jonathan Aibel, Glenn Berger

actors: Matt Damon, Emily Blunt, Lisa Thoreson, Florence Kastriner
plot: The affair between a politician and a contemporary dancer is affected by mysterious forces keeping the lovers apart.
title: The Adjustment Bureau
tomato_consensus: First-time writer/director George Nolfi struggles to maintain a consistent tone, but The Adjustment Bureau rises on the strong, believable chemistry of its stars.
writer: George Nolfi (screenplay), Philip K. Dick (short story "Adjustment Team")

actors: Mia Stallard, Simon Pegg, Nick Frost, Jeremy Owen
plot: Two British comic-book geeks traveling across the U.S. encounter an alien outside Area 51.
title: Paul
tomato_consensus: It doesn't measure up to Pegg and Frost's best work, but Paul is an amiably entertaining -- albeit uneven -- road trip comedy with an intergalactic twist.
writer: Simon Pegg, Nick Frost

actors: Aaron Eckhart, Ramon Rodriguez, Will Rothhaar, Cory Hardrict
plot: A squadron of U.S. Marines becomes the last line of defense against a global invasion.
title: Battle Los Angeles
tomato_consensus: Overlong and overly burdened with war movie clichÃ©s, Battle: Los Angeles will entertain only the most ardent action junkies.
writer: Christopher Bertolini

actors: Kristen Wiig, Terry Crews, Maya Rudolph, Tom Yi
awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 25 wins & 67 nominations.
plot: Competition between the maid of honor and a bridesmaid, over who is the bride's best friend, threatens to upend the life of an out-of-work pastry chef.
title: Bridesmaids
tomato_consensus: A marriage of genuine characters, gross out gags, and pathos, Bridesmaids is a female-driven comedy that refuses to be boxed in as Kristen Wiig emerges as a real star.
writer: Kristen Wiig, Annie Mumolo

actors: Owen Wilson, Rachel McAdams, Kurt Fuller, Mimi Kennedy
plot: While on a trip to Paris with his fiancée's family, a nostalgic screenwriter finds himself mysteriously going back to the 1920s everyday at midnight.
title: Midnight in Paris
tomato_consensus: It may not boast the depth of his classic films, but the sweetly sentimental Midnight in Paris is funny and charming enough to satisfy Woody Allen fans.
writer: Woody Allen

actors: Alex Pettyfer, Timothy Olyphant, Teresa Palmer, Dianna Agron
plot: Aliens and their Guardians are hiding on Earth from intergalactic bounty hunters. They can only be killed in numerical order, and Number Four is next on the list. This is his story.
title: I Am Number Four
tomato_consensus: It's positioned as the start of a franchise, but I Am Number Four's familiar plot and unconvincing performances add up to one noisy, derivative, and ultimately forgettable sci-fi thriller.
writer: Alfred Gough (screenplay), Miles Millar (screenplay), Marti Noxon (screenplay), Jobie Hughes (novel), James Frey (novel)

actors: Emily Browning, Abbie Cornish, Jena Malone, Vanessa Hudgens
plot: A young girl is institutionalized by her abusive stepfather. Retreating to an alternative reality as a coping strategy, she envisions a plan which will help her escape from the mental facility.
title: Sucker Punch
tomato_consensus: It's technically impressive and loaded with eye-catching images, but without characters or a plot to support them, all of Sucker Punch's visual thrills are for naught.
writer: Zack Snyder (screenplay), Steve Shibuya (screenplay), Zack Snyder (story)

actors: Emma Stone, Viola Davis, Bryce Dallas Howard, Octavia Spencer
plot: An aspiring author during the civil rights movement of the 1960s decides to write a book detailing the African-American maids' point of view on the white families for which they work, and the hardships they go through on a daily basis.
title: The Help
tomato_consensus: Though arguably guilty of glossing over its racial themes, The Help rises on the strength of its cast -- particularly Viola Davis, whose performance is powerful enough to carry the film on its own.
writer: Tate Taylor (screenplay), Kathryn Stockett (novel)

actors: Antonio Banderas, Salma Hayek, Zach Galifianakis, Billy Bob Thornton
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 42 nominations.
plot: The events leading up to the sword fighting cat's meeting with Shrek and his friends.
title: Puss in Boots
tomato_consensus: It isn't deep or groundbreaking, but what it lacks in profundity, Puss in Boots more than makes up for with an abundance of wit, visual sparkle, and effervescent charm.
writer: Charles Perrault (character), Tom Wheeler (screenplay), Brian Lynch (story), William Davies (story), Tom Wheeler (story)
